results.title: Australian rules (A) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Premium Movie Partnership, Adelaide Festival Corporation, South Australian Film Corporation, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Tidy Town Pictures, Mark Lazarus and Paul Goldman
results.brief_description: Based on the award winning novel “Deadly, unna?” by Phillip Gwynne, “Australian rules” speculates on the deep rooted racism of a small rural fishing community, Prospect Bay, South Australia, where winning the premiership is the most exciting thing to happen since winning a tidy town competition. The film is viewed from the perspective of Blacky/Gary, a quiet, sensitive, and questioning youth who is best friends with football team mate Dumby Red, a brilliant aboriginal footballer and idealist, apparently unaffected by the animosity of older cousin Perry towards the whites. The status quo changes after a farcical grand final presentation in which one of the goonyas (whites) is selected over arguably Best on Ground Dumby. The football field proves the town’s racial arena whereby gunyas (blacks) are tolerated for their superior football prowess - off field, the small minded community is a pressure cooker of racism and hostilities which explode after a tragic event. Blacky’s relationship to Dumby’s sister Clarence also proves a point of contention with his abusive, belligerent and racist father. A thoughtful and passionate film, “Australian rules” was criticised in some sectors for being racist, it is however as much about friendship, intolerance, and life in an isolated community as it is about racism. Cast includes: Nathan Phillips, Luke Carroll, Lisa Flanagan, Tom Budge, Simon Westaway, Celia Ireland, Kevin Harrington. Screenplay by Phillip Gwynne with Paul Goldman.

results.title: Australian reporter
results.brief_description: Magazine film comprising three items: Asian concert in Sydney at the Conservatorium of Music, asian students present a concert in aid of the Royal Blind Society; Young farmers, this movement introduces boys and girls to the science (and chores) of modern farming; Radio Australia, this international station uses experts from overseas and well-stocked libraries to maintain world-wide appeal. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian report
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Eastman, Keith Gow and Ian Hart
results.brief_description: A lighthearted look at Australia in 1973 - its history, industry and tourist attractions. Commments upon the high degree of urbanisation, the enormous mineral reserves and industrial growth and the opportunities which exist for vacationers in both rural and coastal areas. Also looks at the breakdown of isolation through instant electronic communications and air travel. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 5
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine containing the following items: 1. Albert Park Lake proves new attraction for weekend walkers 2. Agriculture Minister Chandler opens a tree-pruning demo at Burnley Horticultural Gardens 3. Labrador retrievers display ability in club trials at Templestowe 4. Fisheries and Game Department supervisors release 20,000 young trout in the Yarra River 5. Sports brief - Lacrosse at Malvern, hockey with Camberwell v Power House for Altona Cup.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 3
results.brief_description: Fly fishermen perfect their art for annual assault on trout streams - skill in manipulating the finely woollen line is acquired only after years of patient practice; Australian National Airways take delivery of newest DC-6B airline ‘Beltana’ (arrival at Essendon Airport); Hakoah force Moreland to replay in exciting Dockerty Cup semi-final (soccer).

results.title: Australian Notebook. No. 2
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine contains historical items of Victorian history including: Country fire fighters in annual event at Chelsea; Veteran cars in rally - Melbourne/Brighton time trial; Ancient petrol rail car service in Melbourne suburb, Vic Rail introduce new suburban train - Blue Train; St Kilda-Brighton Electric tramway celebrates 50 years service.

results.title: Australian lizards
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australian is a wide word
results.brief_description: Perhaps the most pertinent issue of this video is why some or many of us have difficulties defining the term “Australian”, particularly in describing ourselves. The title is the response of one person in the video to this issue.
